Lorenz Lamm

PhD Student


Profile

I am a PhD student, shared between the Peng lab and the Engel lab. The aim of this PhD project is to develop Deep Learning methods to make the analysis of 3D Cryo-electron tomography more efficient.

As an application, we are analyzing plant cells, in particular those parts of the chloroplasts that are involved in photosynthesis. For this, we need to have accurate 3D segmentations of the thylakoid membranes, as well as precise localizations of the single proteins contained in these membranes, for example Photosystem-II complexes.

Projects and Collaborations

MemBrain - A Deep Learning-based pipeline for the automated detection of membrane-bound proteins in Cryo-Electron tomography
ADL4CV - In this university project for the course Advanced Deep Learning for Computer Vision, we re-implemented a point cloud semantic segmentation architecture (PointNet++) and investigated how this can benefit from adding information from 2D images showing the same scene.
Acne Detection - Together with a Chinese company, I developed Deep Learning methods to automatically detect acne spots in human face images.
